column5: Carp outings have been close to poop, was thinking a slingshot could improve my chances as I hate getting my fingers all sticky, and someone who chums using a slingshot looks more like a cool, laid-back, I know what I'm doing sort of guy.

I would start to look at your mom and pop hardware stores then go from there.  Maybe an army surplus as well.  Just remember your chum could do this to you, making you not so cool, but still laid back
If you are looking for a regular slingshot  Walmart has them.  Specific for chumming   No idea!!
Bass Pro usually has a bin full of them up near the check-outs.
Canadian Tire or any gun shop. HH
Peter's Tackle in St.Catharines carries all that carp-slinging stuff...

$10 bucks and you can have mine. Only used it once. Can't stand it. Made by E.S.P   Used it once and all the corn ended up in my face. Least it was sweet.  I get better results using a spod instead.  dsn
Try New World Carp ...  Fast service from Stephen ...  I use a homemade "flinger"  A scoop taped to an old cane pole...
They're so easy to make!!!!!

Here area few that work well:  http://newworldcarp.com/osc/30plus-boilie-karpult-p-147.html  http://newworldcarp.com/osc/30plus-particle-karpult-p-148.html  http://newworldcarp.com/osc/30plus-karpult-repair-kit-p-233.html   I use fermented deer corn and if you don't want to touch the cum at all, heres a scoop and the handle:  http://newworldcarp.com/osc/gardner-gt-baiting-spoon-p-324.html  http://newworldcarp.com/osc/gardner-long-baiting-spoon-handle-p-323.html  hope this helps.
Fishing World in Hamilton has the best one on the market which is made by FOX, thats where I got them. Call to confirm stock
Next thing you know people will be buying things like water,rocks and dirt.   Art
http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=48600&st=0 HH
I've seen them at Princess Auto.

Best bets (as I live in Toronto and driving all the way to St. Catherines or Hamilton is insane) would be BPS or Princess Auto. Also HH please don't spam this thread. Newworldcarp have a location or is it only online (I am ok with online as long as shipping isn't crazy)
ya don't have any Crap Tire's in the city?  They are $10. there.
Homemade ones work well too, this guy is phenominal
Shipping is great compared to most places. The Fox ones are pretty, I have 2, but all they are is pretty at $25-$30 with tax.

Or you can try Angling Specialties thats where I got mine. Kennedy Steeles area. But I'm not sure if their store is still available as heard from MJL they might be closing and the only place left would be their Vaughan Store,   dsn
Wow, so pretty much you gat get a sling-shot anywhere.... Do you know what google is?

Just Googled slingshot for you...would this help you?  <object width="480" height="385"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXLi0UP6ACQ?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXLi0UP6ACQ?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXLi0UP6ACQ?fs=1&hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="480" height="385"></embed></object>
DSN is right. Angling Spec carries some of the NWC products. Give them a call first.
The slingshots from CTC and Bass Pro don't have a big enough pouch. The slings made for carp fishing have a large rubber pouch that will hold much more bait. New World is worth a try.
How silly of me for thinking that out dated information that isn't fishing specific is inferior to advice from real fishermen, oh the humanity
